required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Chemotherapy Treatment in Re-occurring Non Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) After Previous Chemotherapy and Surgical Removal of the NSCLC Tumor
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II, Randomized, Open-Label Trial of Biweekly Pemetrexed Plus Gemcitabine vs. Pemetrexed or Pemetrexed Plus Carboplatin in Relapsed Non Small Cell Lung Cancer After Neoadjuvant or Adjuvant Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to help answer:
- Whether pemetrexed, gemcitabine and/or carboplatin can shrink tumor(s) or make tumor(s) disappear in patients with relapsed lung cancer (lung cancer that has come back after surgical removal and chemotherapy), and to determine how long this will last
- Whether pemetrexed, gemcitabine and/or carboplatin can help patients with relapsed lung cancer live longer

clinical_study.why_stopped: Stopped early due to low enrollment

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to time of response (up to 17.5 months)
primary_outcome.description: Best response recorded from the start of treatment until disease progression/recurrence using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease=20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease=small changes that do not meet above criteria.

secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is the number of participants who were alive when the trial was terminated.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured progressive disease (up to 17.5 months)
time of response to progressive disease (up to 17.5 months)
baseline to stopping treatment (up to 17.5 months)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- You have non-small cell lung cancer that has come back (relapsed) after initial treatment with surgery and chemotherapy.
- You have good kidney, liver, and bone marrow organ function.
- You are fully active or able to carry out light work such as housework or office work.
Exclusion Criteria:
- You have received pemetrexed or gemcitabine in the past for lung cancer
- You are currently receiving another treatment for your relapsed lung cancer, or have had chemotherapy or certain other therapies for relapsed lung cancer in the past
- You are unable to take corticosteroid drugs like dexamethasone
- You are unable or unwilling to take the folic acid pills or Vitamin B12 injections that are required for the study
- You are unable to stop taking aspirin or other drugs that control inflammation for certain periods of time during the study
- You have had a heart attack in the last 6 months, or have other heart problems that are not controlled with medication

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Disease Stage at Initial Diagnosis
measure.description: Stages of disease range from 0 (no evidence of primary tumor) to IV (tumor in multiple locations).

measure.title: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status
measure.description: Classifies patients according to their functional impairment. Scores range from 0 (Fully Active) to 5 (Death).

measure.title: Prior Systemic Therapy
measure.description: Participants could have more than one type of prior systemic therapy which may result in the total numbers per arm being larger than the overall number of participants per arm.

outcome.title: Objective Tumor Response
outcome.description: Best response recorded from the start of treatment until disease progression/recurrence using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions; Partial Response=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Progressive Disease=20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions; Stable Disease=small changes that do not meet above criteria.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to time of response (up to 17.5 months)
outcome.population: Number of randomized participants in each category.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The trial terminated early due to slow enrollment. Secondary outcomes were not analyzed due to insufficient data. Original results reported were interim analyses. Results have now been updated with final data.
